cards.title: Intro
cards.body: This cheat sheet provided basic syntax and methods to help you using [Go](https://go.dev/).

cards.body:
```shell script
$ go run hello.go
Hello, world!

## Go Basic types

### Strings

cards.title: hello.go
cards.body:
s2 := `A "raw" string literal
can include line breaks.`

cards.title: hello.go
cards.body:
num := 3         // int
num := 3.        // float64
num := 3 + 4i    // complex128
num := byte('a') // byte (alias: uint8)

cards.title: hello.go
cards.body:
var u uint = 7        // uint (unsigned)
var p float32 = 22.7  // 32-bit float

cards.title: hello.go
cards.body:
x := 5
x++
fmt.Println("x + 4 =", x + 4)
fmt.Println("x * 4 =", x * 4)

cards.title: hello.go
cards.body:
fmt.Println(true && true)   // true
fmt.Println(true && false)  // false
fmt.Println(true || true)   // true
fmt.Println(true || false)  // true
fmt.Println(!true)          // false

fmt.Println(a)   // => [Hello World]

hello.go

hello.go
cards.body:
func main() {
p := point{1, 2}
fmt.Printf("%v\n", p)                        // => {1 2}
fmt.Printf("%+v\n", p)                       // => {x:1 y:2}
fmt.Printf("%#v\n", p)                       // => main.point{x:1, y:2}
fmt.Printf("%T\n", p)                        // => main.point
fmt.Printf("%t\n", true)                     // => TRUE
fmt.Printf("%d\n", 123)                      // => 123
fmt.Printf("%b\n", 14)                       // => 1110
fmt.Printf("%c\n", 33)                       // => !
fmt.Printf("%x\n", 456)                      // => 1c8
fmt.Printf("%f\n", 78.9)                     // => 78.9
fmt.Printf("%e\n", 123400000.0)              // => 1.23E+08
fmt.Printf("%E\n", 123400000.0)              // => 1.23E+08
fmt.Printf("%s\n", "\"string\"")             // => "string"
fmt.Printf("%q\n", "\"string\"")             // => "\"string\""
fmt.Printf("%x\n", "hex this")               // => 6.86578E+15
fmt.Printf("%p\n", &p)                       // => 0xc00002c040
fmt.Printf("|%6d|%6d|\n", 12, 345)           // => |    12|   345|
fmt.Printf("|%6.2f|%6.2f|\n", 1.2, 3.45)     // => |  1.20|  3.45|
fmt.Printf("|%-6.2f|%-6.2f|\n", 1.2, 3.45)   // => |1.20  |3.45  |
fmt.Printf("|%6s|%6s|\n", "foo", "b")        // => |   foo|     b|
fmt.Printf("|%-6s|%-6s|\n", "foo", "b")      // => |foo   |b     |

cards.title: hello.go
cards.code:
See also: [fmt](https://go.dev/pkg/fmt/)

### Function examples

| Example                       | Result      |
| ----------------------------- | ----------- |
| Contains("test", "es")        | true        |
| Count("test", "t")            | 2           |
| HasPrefix("test", "te")       | true        |
| HasSuffix("test", "st")       | true        |
| Index("test", "e")            | 1           |
| Join([]string{"a", "b"}, "-") | a-b         |
| Repeat("a", 5)                | aaaaa       |
| Replace("foo", "o", "0", -1)  | f00         |
| Replace("foo", "o", "0", 1)   | f0o         |
| Split("a-b-c-d-e", "-")       | [a b c d e] |
| ToLower("TEST")               | test        |
| ToUpper("test")               | TEST        |

## Go Flow control

### Conditional

cards.title: hello.go
hello.go
hello.go
cards.body:
x := 42.0
switch x {
case 0:
case 1, 2:
fmt.Println("Multiple matches")
case 42:   // Don't "fall through".
fmt.Println("reached")
case 43:
fmt.Println("Unreached")
default:
fmt.Println("Optional")
}

### Maps {.row-span-2}

cards.title: hello.go
cards.body:
m := make(map[string]int)
m["k1"] = 7
m["k2"] = 13
fmt.Println(m) // => map[k1:7 k2:13]

cards.title: hello.go
cards.code:
Doing `v.X` is the same as doing `(*v).X`, when `v` is a pointer.

cards.code: ## Miscellaneous ### Keywords - `break` - `default` - `func` - `interface` - `select` - `case` - `defer` - `go` - `map` - `struct` - `chan` - `else` - `goto` - `package` - `switch` - `const` - `fallthrough` - `if` - `range` - `type` - `continue` - `for` - `import` - `return` - `var` - `iota` {.cols-3 .marker-none} ### Operators and punctuation | | | | | | | | | | | --------------- | --------------- | ---------------- | ---------------- | ----------------- | ---- | ----- | --- | --- | | `+` | `&` | `+=` | `&=` | `&&` | `==` | `!=` | `(` | `)` | | `-` | \| | `-=` | \|= | \|\| | `<` | `<=` | `[` | `]` | | \* | `^` | \*= | `^=` | `<-` | `>` | `>=` | `{` | `}` | | `/` | `<<` | `/=` | `<<=` | `++` | `=` | `:=` | `,` | `;` | | `%` | `>>` | `%=` | `>>=` | `--` | `!` | `...` | `.` | `:` | | | `&^` | `&^=` | | | | | | | ## Also see {.cols-1} - [Devhints](https://devhints.io/go) _(devhints.io)_ - [A tour of Go](https://tour.go.dev/welcome/1) _(tour.go.dev)_ - [Go wiki](https://github.com/golang/go/wiki/) _(github.com)_ - [Effective Go](https://go.dev/doc/effective_go) _(go.dev)_ - [Go by Example](https://gobyexample.com/) _(gobyexample.com)_ - [Awesome Go](https://awesome-go.com/) _(awesome-go.com)_ - [JustForFunc Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC_BzFbxG2za3bp5NRRRXJSw) _(youtube.com)_ - [Style Guide](https://github.com/golang/go/wiki/CodeReviewComments) _(github.com)_
